by the end of this training you will be
able to explain how system center
virtual machine manager or
scvmm can be used to administer AWS

docomo system center extensively
recently we've started using AWS
services like Amazon ec2 now we need a
solution for managing our local VMS
running on hyperv and cloud-based VMS on
Amazon ec2 through a streamlined
dashboard can you explain how we can do
this hi John sure you can use AWS
systems manager for Microsoft system
center virtual machine manager
scvmm because you're using Microsoft
system center extensively you'll
probably find AWS System Manager to be
very useful it's an addin for the scvmm
console that helps you easily manage
your AWS resources such as Amazon ec2
instances well really can you explain
the features of AWS systems manager
is it possible to manage user rights of
course yes with AWS systems manager for
scvmm an AWS administrator can grant
permissions to other admin users to
manage Amazon ec2 instances from
scvmm users can launch view reboot start
stop and terminate Amazon ec2 instances
with these permissions additionally by
using remote desktop protocol or RDP
users can retrieve password for their
Windows instances and connect to the
machines for which they have rights the
added advantage of the service is that
although users are restricted to
managing their Windows instances they
can still retrieve DNS names for their
Linux instances and get connected using
secure shell or SSH finally users can
import their hyperv based Windows
Virtual machines from scvmm to Amazon
ec2 this saves a lot of time and
resources while moving machines from the
local data center to the AWS cloud or
when cloning an existing machine on AWS
also it leverages AWS identity and
access management or Imam rolls to
authenticate to Amazon
ec2 that's really useful are there any
limitations in using this with this
addin for scvmm users can get started
quickly with ec2 instances but they need
to have an account to do so another
limitation is that users cannot launch
ec2 instances into ec2 classic with this
addin
the instances have to be launched into a
VPC also users cannot import Linux
virtual machines from scvmm to Amazon
ec2 this feature is currently limited to
Windows okay and what will I need to
start using AWS systems manager for
scvmm all you need is an AWS account and
a deployment of Microsoft system center
vmm 2012 R2 or Microsoft system center
vmm 2012 sp1 with the latest updates
okay one last question how is this
different from the AWS management pack
for system center the AWS management
pack is used for monitoring and
Reporting the performance of ec2 for
Windows instances AWS systems manager
lets you start stop reboot and terminate
instances and helps you connect to your
ec2
instances thanks for the great
information I'm going to download and
test the addin right
away the Hands-On lab on using AWS

center virtual machine manager will
enable you to install Microsoft scvmm on
an Amazon ec2 Windows instance to
simulate an on premises installation and
connect it to the Amazon account perform

operations using AWS systems
manager connect to Windows machines
